!*y 13, 1956
Mr# G. Duncan Mispress
Assistant to the President
Colorado School of Minos
Golden, Colorado
Dear !*% Wimpresst
Mr# Henry Mamet, Station Manager, Station XRMA-TV, has requested that we
send you information about the NAEB, because he believes that your
institution might be interested in applying for Associate membership in
the Association, especially since your Institution will be cooperating
with KRMA-TV in the production of educational television programs.
I am, therefore, happy to give you brief information about the Associa¬
tion, and I join Mr. Mamet in the hope that we may soon number you among
our membership. In order to give you a broader picture of the HAEB I
have set forth below information about all three categories of member¬
ship.
The NASB has three categories of membership, as follows i
Active - Fdncational institutions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over a
commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
Fo. Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows t
Glass A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay £100.00.
